intro: Ligusticum pumilum, commonly known as small ligusticum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Ligusticum pumilum is also valued as a ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to alpine environments.
